channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A woman is arrested for allegedly trying to steal Elvis' Graceland property
item.description: Lisa Jeanine Findley of Missouri is is charged with trying to defraud Elvis Presley’s estate of millions of dollars and steal ownership of the iconic Graceland property in Memphis.
item.content:encoded:
Lisa Jeanine Findley of Missouri is is charged with trying to defraud Elvis Presley’s estate of millions of dollars and steal ownership of the iconic Graceland property in Memphis.

(Image credit: Beth J. Harpaz)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Supreme Court blocks Biden administration rules against sex discrimination in schools
item.description: The court’s action effectively bars the federal government from enforcing any portion of its new anti-discrimination rules while legal challenges are litigated in the lower courts.
item.content:encoded:
The court’s action effectively bars the federal government from enforcing any portion of its new anti-discrimination rules while legal challenges are litigated in the lower courts.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: A new generation of tattoo artists is doing things differently
item.description: In a typical studio, artists schedule some of their work, and also take walk-in clients. At some new shops, artists schedule all their work and have done away with the apprentice model of the past.
item.content:encoded: In a typical studio, artists schedule some of their work, and also take walk-in clients. At some new shops, artists schedule all their work and have done away with the apprentice model of the past.
item.dc:creator: Linnea E. Anderson

item.title: Iran may be making calculations before retaliatory attack on Israel
item.description: The Middle East is bracing for Iran to launch a retaliatory attack on Israel. Here's a look at what could be holding the operation up.
item.content:encoded: The Middle East is bracing for Iran to launch a retaliatory attack on Israel. Here's a look at what could be holding the operation up.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Friends remember a young, gay Palestinian man who was murdered in occupied West Bank
item.description: The murder of a young gay Palestinian man in the occupied West Bank has challenged the conservative community's formal and informal systems of justice.
item.content:encoded: The murder of a young gay Palestinian man in the occupied West Bank has challenged the conservative community's formal and informal systems of justice.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: San Francisco lawsuit goes after websites that create sexually explicit 'deepfakes'
item.description: This week, San Francisco filed a lawsuit against some of the largest websites responsible for nonconsensual AI-generated pornography. It seeks to shut the sites down completely.
item.content:encoded: This week, San Francisco filed a lawsuit against some of the largest websites responsible for nonconsensual AI-generated pornography. It seeks to shut the sites down completely.
item.dc:creator: Juan Carlos Lara

item.title: Proposed lithium mine in Serbia sparks protests over potential environmental impact
item.description: A proposed lithium mine in Serbia is spurring protests over its potential impact on the environment. The mineral is in high demand because it’s crucial for the batteries that run electric vehicles.
item.content:encoded: A proposed lithium mine in Serbia is spurring protests over its potential impact on the environment. The mineral is in high demand because it’s crucial for the batteries that run electric vehicles.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Harris lays out economic plan
item.description: In her first major policy speech of her compressed campaign, Vice President Harris talked about her economic plans.
item.content:encoded: In her first major policy speech of her compressed campaign, Vice President Harris talked about her economic plans.
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: A look at Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker's political aspirations ahead of Chicago DNC
item.description: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker was passed over in the Harris campaign veepstakes. How has the billionaire navigated the party and what might he win or lose at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago?
item.content:encoded: Illinois Gov. JB Pritzker was passed over in the Harris campaign veepstakes. How has the billionaire navigated the party and what might he win or lose at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago?
item.dc:creator: Alex Degman

item.title: Millions of Americans may be getting cancer-causing chemical in generic cold medicine
item.description: NPR’s Ailsa Chang speaks with Anna Edney, health care reporter with Bloomberg, about her reporting on how some generic versions of cold medicine contain a cancer-causing chemical.
item.content:encoded: NPR’s Ailsa Chang speaks with Anna Edney, health care reporter with Bloomberg, about her reporting on how some generic versions of cold medicine contain a cancer-causing chemical.
item.dc:creator: Jason Fuller
